title: Guest Post: Good News:  The Return of the Demographic and Health Surveys
content: Today's guest post is from Bobrary Bordelon about the DHS program, including some history, the importance of this work, and the news on continued data collection. title: Independence Hall and Fort Sumter Are Only the Beginning
content: This week, we have learned about removals of National Park Service interpretive panels at the President's House and Fort Sumter. At Fort Sumter, two panels with content about how climate change is affecting the historic site were removed, as reported by the New York Times. title: CDC BRFSS Data: Uncensored Data Now Available on Data Lumos
content: According to the CDC, “The Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) is the nation’s premier system of health-related telephone surveys that collect state data about U.S. residents regarding their health-related risk behaviors, chronic health conditions, and use of preventive services.” The BRFSS collects data about topics like alcohol use, healthy diets, HIV/AIDS, health care access, and e-cigarettes. title: Support for the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR)
content: On December 17, we learned from news reports that the Trump administration planned to dismantle the National Science Foundation National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR).
